title: David's Charge to Solomon
shortSummary: In 1 Chronicles 28, King David gathers the leaders of Israel to declare God's plan for Solomon to build the temple. David recounts God's choice of Solomon, provides detailed instructions and plans for the temple, and encourages Solomon to be strong, courageous, and obedient to God's commands. This chapter highlights the importance of faithful leadership and obedience in fulfilling God's purposes.
timeline: c. 970 BC - Late reign of King David, preparation for Solomon's temple construction

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: King of Israel who prepares Solomon to build the temple by giving him God's plans and encouraging him to obey God's commandments.

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: David’s son chosen by God to succeed him as king and to build the temple for the LORD.

keyCharacters.name: Princes and Leaders of Israel
keyCharacters.description: The assembled tribal princes, captains, stewards, officers, and mighty men who witness David’s charge and support Solomon’s future work.

definitions.definition: The sacred chest that held the tablets of the Ten Commandments, symbolizing God's presence among Israel.
A reference to the temple as a permanent dwelling place for God's presence, contrasting with the temporary tabernacle.
A detailed design or blueprint given by God, which David received by divine revelation for the temple's construction.
The holy place where God dwells, specifically referring here to the temple Solomon was to build.

outline.heading: David Assembles Israel’s Leaders
outline.description: David gathers all the princes, captains, stewards, officers, and valiant men to Jerusalem to hear his final instructions about the temple.

outline.heading: David’s Explanation of God’s Choice
outline.description: David explains that God forbade him from building the temple because of his history as a warrior, but God chose Solomon to build it. He charges Solomon to serve God wholeheartedly and obey His commandments.

outline.heading: David Gives Solomon the Temple Plans
outline.description: David provides Solomon with the detailed plans and patterns for the temple’s structure, furnishings, and priestly service, all revealed to him by God.

outline.heading: Encouragement and Support for Solomon
outline.description: David encourages Solomon to be strong and courageous, assuring him of God’s presence and the support of skilled workers, priests, Levites, princes, and the people.

application: Trust God’s sovereign plan for your life, even when your own desires differ from His will.
Serve God with a wholehearted and willing mind, knowing He searches the heart and rewards faithfulness.
Be diligent in preparing and equipping yourself for the tasks God calls you to accomplish.
Encourage and support others who are called to lead and serve in God’s work.

keyVerses.text: And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind: for the LORD searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts: if thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the importance of wholehearted devotion and the reality of God's intimate knowledge of our hearts.

keyVerses.text: And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed: for the LORD God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all the work for the service of the house of the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: A powerful encouragement to trust in God's presence and faithfulness when undertaking His work.

keyVerses.text: And he said unto me, Solomon thy son, he shall build my house and my courts: for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals God's sovereign choice and covenant relationship with Solomon as builder of the temple.
